kimononet.peer

Class PeerAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • kimononet.peer.PeerAgent

  • public class PeerAgent
extends java.lang.Object
    Peer agent represents a peer associated with a specific environment. Agent is also responsible for managing services such BeaconService and DataService, and storing common data exchanged by these services.
    Version:
    3/12/2012
    Author:
    Zorayr Khalapyan

      • PeerAgent

        public PeerAgent(Peer peer,
         PeerEnvironment environment,
         GeoDevice geoDevice)
        Creates a peer agent associated with the specified peer environment. The constructor utilizes SimulationPortConfigurationProvider to set up port configuration.
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer represented by the peer agent.
        environment - The peer's environment.
        geoDevice - The peer's GPS device.

      • PeerAgent

        public PeerAgent(Peer peer,
         PeerEnvironment environment,
         GeoDevice geoDevice,
         PortConfigurationProvider portConfigurationProvider)
        Creates a peer agent associated with the specified peer environment. Time provider will be set to SystemTimeProvider.
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer represented by the peer agent.
        environment - The peer's environment.
        geoDevice - The peer's GPS device.
        portConfigurationProvider - Port configuration provider.

      • PeerAgent

         PeerEnvironment environment,
         GeoDevice geoDevice,
         PortConfigurationProvider portConfigurationProvider,
         TimeProvider timeProvider)
        Creates a peer agent associated with the specified peer environment.
        Parameters:
        peer - The peer represented by the peer agent.
        environment - The peer's environment.
        geoDevice - The peer's GPS device.
        portConfigurationProvider - Port configuration provider.
        timeProvider - Time provider for the current peer agent.

    • Method Detail

      • getStatMonitor

        public StatMonitor getStatMonitor()

      • setStatMonitor

        public void setStatMonitor(StatMonitor statMonitor)

      • startServices

        public void startServices()
        Starts beacon service and also geo-service. Beacon service is responsible for sending beacons and responding to beacons, while geo-service is responsible for fetching the peer's current GPS location via a GPS enabled device and update velocity information. To shutdown the services, use shutdownServices().
        See Also:
        shutdownServices()

      • shutdownServices

        public void shutdownServices()
        Stops services associated with this peer agent. Current implementation includes services for sending beacons, and service for updating peer's GPS location.
        See Also:
        startServices()

      • getPeers

        public java.util.HashMap<PeerAddress,Peer> getPeers()
        Returns the current peer's peers. These are single-hop peers that were learned about via beacon service. To get the second-hop peers, use getPeers2().
        Returns:
        The current peer's peers.

      • getPeers2

        public java.util.HashMap<PeerAddress,java.util.HashMap<PeerAddress,Peer>> getPeers2()
        Returns the second hop neighbor's table. For further documentation, read comments on peers2 or protocol documentation.
        Returns:
        Second hop neighbor's table.

      • getPortConfiguration

        public PortConfiguration getPortConfiguration()
        Returns current peer's port configuration.
        Returns:
        Peer's port configuration.

      • getGeoDevice

        public GeoDevice getGeoDevice()
        Returns the peer's GPS device.
        Returns:
        The peer's GPS device.

      • getPeer

        public Peer getPeer()
        Returns the peer represented by this agent.
        Returns:
        The peer represented by this agent.

      • getEnvironment

        public PeerEnvironment getEnvironment()
        Returns the peer's environment.
        Returns:
        the peer's environment.

      • setEnvironment

        public void setEnvironment(PeerEnvironment environment)
        Sets the peer's environment.
        Parameters:
        environment - Peer's new environment.

      • getTimeProvider

        public TimeProvider getTimeProvider()
        Returns TimeProvider associated with this agent. The time provider should be used in any situation where the peers's time is required.
        Returns:
        Time provider for this peer agent.

      • setTimeProvider

        public void setTimeProvider(TimeProvider timeProvider)
        Sets the time provider for the current peer agent. To get the time provider or the peer's current time, use either getTimeProvider() or getTime() respectively.
        Parameters:
        timeProvider - The time provider to set.

      • getTime

        public long getTime()
        Shortcut method for accessing time using the getTimeProvider(). 0 will be returned, if the time provider for the current agent is null.
        Returns:
        Current peer time as specified by the time provider.
